alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 5:18PM CDT until July 02 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following area, Cook. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated rainfall continuing across the area. Rainfall rates have slowly diminished to about 0.5 inches per hour, with widespread rainfall totals between 1 and 4 inches observed since this morning. Although new flood impacts are unlikely over the next few hours, water will be slow to recede as light rainfall continues. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Oak Lawn, Palos Park, Orland Park, Midlothian, Markham, South Holland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
